thread.title: No. 4-rated Louisville upset by No. 13 Virginia
thread.title_full: No. 4-rated Louisville upset by No. 13 Virginia

author: USA TODAY
title: No. 4-rated Louisville upset by No. 13 Virginia
text:
No. 4-rated Louisville upset by No. 13 Virginia Virginia completed a season sweep of Louisville after pulling off an upset Monday night. Post to Facebook No. 4-rated Louisville upset by No. 13 Virginia Virginia completed a season sweep of Louisville after pulling off an upset Monday night.  //usat.ly/2kGRBE0   Join the Nation's Conversation   No. 4-rated Louisville upset by No. 13 Virginia USA TODAY Published 8:55 p.m. ET Feb. 6, 2017 | Updated 5 minutes ago Louisville guard Donovan Mitchell (45) shoots the ball as Virginia forward Isaiah Wilkins (21) and Cavaliers forward Jarred Reuter (31) defends in the first half at John Paul Jones Arena. (Photo: Geoff Burke, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
On the same day that Louisville vaulted up three spots in the USA TODAY Coaches Poll, the fourth-ranked Cardinals were defeated by No. 13-rated Virginia, 71-55, Monday night. With the win, Virginia completed a regular-season sweep of Louisville. 
Louisville played the game without center Mangok Mathiang and forward Deng Adel, who were suspended for Monday's game after missing curfew after Saturday's win at Boston College. 
While Virginia improved to 18-5 overall and 8-3 in ACC play, Louisville fell to 19-5 overall and 7-4 in the ACC.
